articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Russian drone attack on the northeastern Ukrainian city of Sumy killed two people and injured 12 on Friday morning, regional authorities said in a statement.
articles.title: Russian drone attack on Sumy kills two, injures 12, local authorities say

articles.author: Ben Blanchard, Roger Tung
articles.description: Taiwan President Lai Ching-te will visit Taipei's three remaining diplomatic allies in the Pacific on a trip starting at the end of the month, his office said on Friday, but the government declined to give details on U.S. transit stops.
articles.title: Taiwan's president to visit Pacific allies, no details on US transits

articles.author: Hyonhee Shin
articles.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un has accused the United States of ramping up tension and provocations, saying the Korean peninsula has never faced a greater risk of nuclear war, state media KCNA said on Friday.
articles.title: North Korea's Kim accuses US of stoking tension, warns of nuclear war

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping made a short visit to Morocco on Thursday, according to state media from both countries.
articles.title: China's Xi visits Morocco, meets with crown prince

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korea's national security adviser Shin Won-sik said on Friday that Russia has provided North Korea with anti-air missiles and air defence equipment in return for sending troops for its war against Ukraine, the Yonhap news agency reported.
articles.title: South Korea official says Russia provided anti-air missile to North Korea, Yonhap reports

articles.author: Gerry Doyle
articles.description: The United States has layers of sensors that can spot, track and identify ballistic missile launches such as the Russian IRBM fired at Ukraine on Thursday - a Cold War system that has been refined over decades into an unblinking global network.
articles.title: Explainer: How the US tracks ballistic missile launches

articles.author: Lucinda Elliott
articles.description: Uruguayans will be choosing between two centrist candidates for their next president on Sunday, but the closely fought run-off could be decided by voters who went for an anti-vax radical and other fringe candidates in the first round.
articles.title: In razor-tight Uruguay election, fringe votes could tip the balance

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Prime Minister Viktor Orban said on Friday he would invite Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to visit Hungary, saying he would guarantee that an International Criminal Court arrest warrant against Netanyahu would "not be observed".
articles.title: PM Orban says he will invite Israeli PM Netanyahu to Hungary after ICC move

articles.author: Joshua McElwee
articles.description: Pope Francis will visit Corsica on Dec. 15, the local diocese said on its website on Thursday, in the first recorded trip of a pope to the French island in the Mediterranean.
articles.title: Pope Francis to visit French island of Corsica on Dec. 15, local church says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: British police carried out a controlled explosion near the U.S. embassy in south London after discovering a suspect package, authorities said on Friday.
articles.title: London police carry out controlled explosion near U.S. embassy
